website_summaries.verdict: One of the better hybrid bike frames meant for older children and young adults wanting a real performer.
pros: Durable frame can withstand heavy impacts common on trail adventures
Disc brakes and low gearing make this bike more controllable off-road Saddle and handlebars are extremely comfortable for longer rides
cons: Weight of the bike frame makes it less suitable for city riding or road racing

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the drivetrain comes completely assembled and adjusted. You have to install the pedals, handlebar, and front wheel. Then adjust the brakes. I put a quarter-turn on two spokes to take a slight imperfection out of the front wheel. It certainly would have qualified as "in-spec"before, but I like perfect. Really nice bike for the money. The color is more of a cream/pastel orange like a creamsicle than the white/blaze orange in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: David Winter

customer_reviews.title: Simple and durable bike
customer_reviews.text: The bike is pretty good looking. All the parts look neat and high quality. The frame made from aluminium which make the bike lightweight and easy to carry. The color of the frame is not snow-white but with a tint of beige. It looks nice to me. My 11-yr old 57" tall loves it, but we had to adjust the seat to the maximum height, so there is no any margin for the future, just keep in in mind when you buy it. Both of the wheel rims are slightly bent. They move a bit from side to side as they spin. When riding, it doesn't seem to disturb.
customer_reviews.author: Natalya Kosyanenko

customer_reviews.title: Great bike; No assembly instructions or tools included
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, solidly built, well-engineered, quality bicycle. However, it arrived with no instructions on assembly, just some generic manual about Raleigh bicycles with safety instructions. The Raleigh website implies that there is a small tool set included (Allen wrench, etc) along with instructions to aid in assembly. Not in mine. The box was sealed and had no holes through which these could have fallen. It's irritating.
customer_reviews.author: William McBride

customer_reviews.title: This is a fine bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine bike for the money. It's a good fast light bike for the kids. It can also be a mountain bike if you put knobby tires on it. It was pretty easy to assemble if you know a little about working on bikes. The kids and I had it ready to ride in less than an hour. It only weighs 22.2 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Ana B

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great price! Quality bike. Very easy to assemble. Took a bit of time adjusting the brakes but that’s to be expected. Took 20 minutes start to finish.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike. Assembled easily and my daughter was off riding in 2-30 mins.. great shifter as well. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: MatlockFam

customer_reviews.title: Bike may be good if you are lucky to get the one that is complete and not broken.
customer_reviews.text: Front wheel wobbling, front break pads were disassembled and I found some parts of it in the box. Not all parts I was able to find (they must be lost through the packing box wholes).
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Z

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kid bikes for an awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kid bikes for an awesome price! Our boys love these. We bought two for twins. Super impressed with them.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my boy is loving to ride his now that he has this one.
customer_reviews.author: John Guseman

customer_reviews.title: it's a poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the box came damage. The tools and instruction are missing. The front wheel whobbles. The front brake is missing a nut. it's a poor quality product. Basically, it's a disappointment. I am gonna return it and get a refund. I am not going to bother with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Weikang

product_meta.title: Raleigh Bikes Kids Cadent 24 Urban Fitness Bike
product_meta.description: The Raleigh Cadent 24 is a 24 inch bike designed for kids ready to journey beyond the neighborhood. This durable aluminum boys bike rolls fast and is lightweight to easily lift onto a bike rack. Just like our adult-size flat bar road bikes, the Cadent 24 features flat bars, signature Raleigh design, and quality Shimano parts. Soft rubber handlebar grips and a Raleigh Jr. Road bike seat keep young riders comfortable on longer rides, while smooth-rolling 24x1.75 inch tires let them keep up with the older folks. The Cadent 24 does double-duty as a ride to school and as a weekend getaway machine to cruise the bike path or explore around town with friends or family.
feature_bullets: Low standover aluminum frame for easy on and off; fits ages 8 to 12 years old or 53 to 61 inches tall
24 inch wheels keep the bike sized just right for bigger kids
Shimano Revo shifters roll through 7 gears with an easy twist of the wrist
Alloy V brakes for speed control and easy stopping
Pedals included; limited lifetime warranty on the frame for as long as the original retail purchaser owns the bicycle
